data.description: Are you the kind of person who gets a little too excited about a clean spreadsheet? Do you love solving puzzles, spotting patterns, and making messy information make sense? If so, our Business Intelligence internship might be your perfect summer adventure. As a BI intern, you’ll dive into real projects that make a real impact - you’ll be helping us understand the story behind our data and shaping how teams across the company make decisions. What You’ll Do Assist with data mapping and documentation to help us understand where everything lives and how it all connects Clean up, consolidate, and standardize reports so our insights are sharp, accurate, and easy to use Outline processes and identify improvements — and even help brainstorm solutions Participate in cross‑functional training and knowledge sharing to learn how different teams use data Support the BI team with data scrubbing, manipulation, and descriptive analytics Help test new systems and assist with monthly or ad‑hoc reporting Use Power BI to build dashboards and visualizations for teams across the company Contribute to data‑related projects across the MEMIC Group and see how your work drives decisions What You Bring Pursuing an Associate’s degree or higher Familiarity with Power BI, Tableau or SQL Strong Excel skills Excellent attention to detail and strong organizational habits Clear communication skills and a collaborative mindset Why You’ll Love This Internship You’ll gain hands‑on experience, build your technical toolkit, and learn how data powers decisions in a corporate environment. You’ll also get exposure to BI tools, cross‑department collaboration, and real‑world analytics challenges — all while working with a supportive team that wants to see you grow. ___________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ MEMIC is committed to a policy of nondiscrimination and equal opportunity for all employees and qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religious creed, national origin, ancestry, age, disability, genetics, gender identity, veteran's status, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by law. MEMIC is an equal opportunity employer encouraging diversity in the workplace. #IND2022 MEMIC's Job Applicant Privacy Notice
requirements: Participate in cross‑functional training and knowledge sharing to learn how different teams use data
Pursuing an Associate’s degree or higher
